115321.content:
It was a crisp Saturday afternoon in Langley Falls. At a local fair, an old rivalry is about to spark anew. It involves lots and lots of hotdogs. A blonde, attractive housewife wandered the fair, looking for something, anything, to kill time.
“I’m so glad I was able to find the time to come here. When you’re not losing a pie-making contest every year, this is actually pretty fun.” Francine said.
Her search came to a long awaited end when she saw a rather interesting sight: a huge stand with a huge banner hanging from the top saying hotdog eating competition.
“This looks interesting to watch.”
As she entered the crowd, though, her chipper mood soon soured upon glancing at another woman. This woman immediately turned around and when she glanced back at Francine, she too developed a very sour look upon her face.
“Francine Smith.” She said.
“Hiko Yoshida. I’m assuming you’re here to watch the contest.” Francine said back.
“Actually, I’m entering the contest. Surely you aren’t entering. Then again, you could afford to lose a few pounds.”
Francine was beyond pissed at this remark. It would somewhat ruin her figure, but she had only one option.
“You’re wrong. I’m entering this contest and I’m going to kick your ass!” Francine shot back as she signed her name on the sign-up board.
“We’ll find out who kicks whose ass in five minutes.” Hiko said.
“Why five minutes?” Francine asked.
“The contest starts in five minutes.”
“Oh.” Francine said.
“Attention contestants, the Langley Falls Annual Hotdog Eating contest well begin soon. Please report to the stand.” The Announcer said.
“Well then, shall we go?” Hiko said with faux politeness.
“After you.” Francine replied with a similar tone.
After a few minutes of preparation, the hotdogs were dressed with ketchup, mustard, relish, & sauerkraut and pushed onto the stand. There were 164 hotdogs on each plate. Each one looked as if they were full-length bratwursts. A grave sense of intimidation quickly filled Francine.
“Oh, God. Look at these.” She said shocked.
“What’s the matter, Franny? Are you afraid of a few little hotdogs?” Hiko taunted.
“These aren’t a few little hotdogs. They look like they’re on steroids and there are enough here to feed my family for a month!” Francine said.
“Well, I hope your poor stomach can take it.”
“Attention, contestants. The Langley Falls Annual Hotdog Eating Contest begins in 5… 4… 3… 2… 1… start!” The Announcer said.
And with that, the contestants began to gorge themselves on the numerous, enormous frankfurters. However, none were going at it as fast as Francine and Hiko. These two women, determined to defeat the other, were putting it down at speeds that would put some competitive eaters to shame. However, like a cheetah chasing after its prey, one of them would soon begin to lose steam and it just so happens to be…

123.content:
At a local Supermarket

"Ugh, would you look at this?" Hayley bemoaned at the sight of a magazine rack.

"Yeah...yeah, something else..." replied a disguised Roger, who made no effort to conceal his lack of interest.

Observing a copy of CQ (Chic Quarterly) from the rack, Hayley's disgust only grew. "Look at this!" she said flipping through the pages, many containing photos of lean ladies in impractical clothing, modeling them in even more impractical poses.

"A travesty, a real travesty..." Roger wryly muttered, he knew what he was in for when he willingly decided to accompany Hayley for a few errands, but that didn't necessarily mean he'd tolerate her. "Someone needs to take action." Hayley declared, Roger rolled his eyes, he had heard this phrase enough to know where she was going. "Women today are mislead to believe in false ideals by self-appointed authorities such as these, it's the reason for the rise of Bulimia and Anorexia in high-school girls. Well, I'm not going to stand for it! A statement needs to be made."

"And do pray tell, what is that statement?" Roger responded, playing along with Hayley for a lark.

"It's obvious; women shouldn't have to starve themselves to the bone to reflect an unattainable image that society says is "beauty", they should know that it's who we are as humans that makes us beautiful."

"Geeze...you done singing, Billy Joel?"

"What?"

"Er- I said how do you plan on pulling this shenanigan off?" Roger hastily said, who attempted to regain his composure after nearly incurring Hayley's Liberal-induced Wrath.

"By defying society's standards on looks like this." Hayley pressed the magazine towards Roger, pointing at an image of one particularly thin model.

"So you're gonna advocate fat people?" Roger said with a condescending tone in his voice.

"Exactly, I knew I could count on you to think the same way."

"No it's not that, it's just that maybe you're being a little too drastic, when you could just do the usual strongly-worded letter and picket-sign-in front-of-building schtick?" Roger pleaded, as much as he liked to see her make an idiot of herself, Roger felt that maybe he accidentally pushed Hayley's motives a little too hard this time.

"There's an idea!" Hayley exclaimed as a light bulb went off in her head. "I can write a letter to the publishing headquarters of CQ, threatening a protest, spread the word around, and finally, when my movement builds in momentum, we go to the headquarters, protesting the magazine until they show what real women look like! Roger, I'm proud to see you show a concern for the welfare of women presented in the media."

Roger had a defeated expression on his face; his joke backfired. That wasn't the response he was hoping for, he simply was trying to piss her off, not bounce off ideas for her next stupid 'movement' (she had done this many times in the past, with varying results).

"So how do you plan on kick-starting this?" Roger asked, unable to come up with a snide comment.

"That's easy..." Hayley said with confidence.

"I just have to study my cause..."

"Oh, my!" Francine gushed as Hayley started scooping a third helping of dinner onto her plate. "Somebody brought their appetite tonight."

"I'm through starving myself to meet some arbitrary standard of beauty," Hayley said. "From now on, I'm not going to let society dictate what size I ought to be! I just need to put on a few pounds first. Roger said I was too thin for people to take me seriously."

"Hah!" Stan snorted. "Good luck gaining any weight on that rabbit food."

"Actually, Mr. S, vegetarian food can be very fattening," Jeff said cheerfully. "The only reason Hayley stays so thin is that we're always burning off so many calories doing the deed."

"Jeff, we have a simple rule in this house. Do not talk about having sex with my daughter at the dinner table."

Jeff looked abashed. "Sorry. I thought you said 'do not have sex with my daughter on the dinner table'. Oh wait. Nevermind, I guess I'm in trouble either way."

"And there goes my appetite," Stan said, pushing his plate away. "Hayley, feel free to shovel this into your craw."

- - - - - - -

"Can you believe it?" Steve griped. "The guys will be here in ten minutes, and Hayley went through my entire supply of Cheetos and Mountain Dew!"

"I know," Roger said. "Isn't it great?"

"No, it's not great! A Dungeons and Dragons session without snacks is like a druid without neutrality along at least one alignment axis! MY EVENING IS RUINED!!" Steve kicked the card table. "AND I JUST BROKE MY TOE! AAAH!"

"Ahh, Hayley. As your stomach fills with orange chemical dust and green-dyed sugar water, so too does my heart fill with love."

"This isn't cool! What's your deal, anyway, Roger?"

"Oh, I'm not Roger. I'm--"

"Oh, god."

"-- Chubbygirllvr1601, Internet FA fiction writer!" Roger said, quickly throwing on his latest disguise. "I was working on a grippingly original work about a certain ray gun with, heh heh, unusual properties when suddenly, I saw my fantasies coming to life before my eyes!"

"What?"

"Look, basically I've just found a fun way to pass the time, and if it ends up with Hayley outgrowing her clothes and having to give them to someone else in the house who might be looking to create a hippie chick persona in the near future, that would just be gravy."

"That's my shirt. And my spare glasses! Wait a minute, a brown wig? Chubbygirllvr1601 looks just like me!"

"I know. I based him on you."

"I'm not an Internet FA fiction writer!"

"Oh. Perhaps I was mistaken. Did you not once insert a reversed-suction liposuction hose into a bitchy cheerleader in order to get revenge on behalf of an overweight Goth girl said cheerleader had called fat?"

"Well -- well, yeah, sort of, but--"

"Bam." Roger winked. "I rest my case."

"Oh, fine, whatever," Steve said, throwing up his hands. "In that case, you can pay for her food."

"There's a limit to how much reality Chubbygirllvr1601 wants in his stories, Steve."

15231.content:
It was the end of the world. The seas had turned to blood, the land was overrun by stinging locusts, and the bitter star Wormwood shone down from the sky onto clashing armies of angels and demons.

And yet, for Michelle, it was just another Monday.

"'I think I left my Heaven-Bazooka in one of the personal heavens, Michelle.' 'Would you mind checking through every last one of the personal heavens for my Heaven-Bazooka, Michelle?' Cripes!" the red-headed angel muttered to herself as she stomped down the endless hall of doors. "Does he have any idea how long it's going to take to check seven billion of these stupid things? I'm gonna be here until after six-thirty again, I just know it."

She opened one of the doors and looked in on an endless forest of pine trees. "Uh, hey, anybody in here?"

A lumberjack ran up to her. "They've ... they've got chainsaws! They've got chainsaws I never should have disrespected Mother Earth! What a fool I was! Run! Save yourself!" He shoved past her into the hall. A moment later, a gang of trees charged past in pursuit, Stihls roaring.

"Great. Now I'll probably get blamed for letting those out, too," Michelle grumbled. "Hey, uh, you, uh, Hayley, right? Have you seen a huge golden bazooka in here?"

Hayley took the extra-large joint out of her mouth. "Whaa?"

"Oh, never mind." Michelle ducked out and shut the door. "Hmm..."

The next three heavens weren't any luckier. Michelle was getting irritated, and her high-heels were killing her -- if only this stupid hallway had enough room for her to spread her wings! Finally, she came to a door that was a little ... unusual.

It was made out of light green, semi-translucent material she'd never seen before, and was slightly tapered at the top. She could just make out strange shapes moving around inside the heaven, but she couldn't tell what they were.

"Wow, okay, this is weird. I thought we standardized these things." After a little bit of fiddling with the keypad -- the keypad? -- she managed to get the door to slide open, revealing a sun-dappled forest, the trees shifting slightly in the wind.

"Hello?" Michelle stuck her head into the heaven. "Anyone here?"

She stepped inside and looked around. No lumberjacks or killer trees here. Nobody at all, in fact. Obviously this was an empty heaven, set up and waiting for someone who was still alive.

Well, there was no Heaven-Bazooka here, either, so she shrugged and turned to leave -- only for the door to whoosh shut in her face.

"Oh, no. Oh, no. Michelle, you did not just lock yourself in another heaven. Arrgh!" It had been bad enough last time, when she'd accidentally locked herself in Steve's heaven and had had to spend a chilly afternoon fighting frost trolls in a skimpy plate-metal bra, but this one wasn't even in use -- it could be practically forever before someone checked up on it! She slapped herself in the forehead. How could she be so dumb?

Well, nothing for it but to find a good spot to wait. She walked along the forest path, noting that the trees were heavy with fruit. At least, she wouldn't be hungry.

Wait -- that wasn't fruit. She picked one and bit into it. Were these...

"...Pecan Sandies?"

They were good, though, she had to admit that. Better than an earthly Pecan Sandy could be. The next tree bore a rich crop of Chocodiles, and the one after that, Ho-Hos. She walked along for a while, munching freely on the sugary "fruit".

Just as she was starting to get really thirsty, she came across the waterfall. It burbled frothily down an alabaster cliffside and fell in a sweet-smelling curtain of mist. Kicking off her high heels, she waded into the pool and caught a mouthful of the liquid.

She almost choked at first. It wasn't water, it was wine! It was, however, very good wine -- sweet and tangy, and with more of a kick to it that she expected. She ended up gulping down a little more than she'd meant to, and by the time her thirst was quenched, she was feeling tipsy. She splashed back to the edge of the pool and sat down with a thud, shrugging off her pink-stained jacket and blouse and tossing them away. The weather was wonderful, and it felt so nice to just sit here in her undershirt, cooling her toes in the chilled wine and snacking on Twinkies from a nearby bush. She found they were even better if you dipped them into the pool first.

Eventually she flopped over on her back, pleasantly stuffed and more than a little drunk. Oh, baby, she thought, I don't know whose heaven this is, but right now, it's mine!
15231.title: Ooh, Heaven is a place not of this Earth...

152312.content:

To her left, she could see that potato chip forest filled with every kind of chip imaginable. Then there was onion ring plains with French fry dragonflies hovering above. Michelle scooped the earth below here to receive rich fudge came with 8 layers of frosting.

"I can get used to this. I mean, *munch* it's not like someone's going to come look for me." Michelle snatched a triple burger bird and jumbo hotdog hummingbird and stuck them in the deep fried pond.

"*crunch* Yeah, *smack* I should be able to enjoy this for a little while." Michelle plucked a soda pop corn cob, heck, she turned around and plucked several she just couldn't get enough.

She slowly began to stop caring about anyone finding her here. "This is my own personal heaven. I can stay as long as I want." Michelle had no idea how long she's been here, but she didn't care. Not about her job or the people she had to protect.

She basically spent who knows how long stuffing herself full of fatty enriched snack foods.

1543.content:
*ding-dong*

"Well, don't everybody get up to get it at once," Roger grumbled, pulling on a disguise as he toddled towards the door. "Hi. I'm Biff Brumstroke, tennis instructor and deadbeat dad. Who are you?"

"Oh, uh, I'm Becky," the blonde girl said, a little nervously. "I'm here to see Steve Smith? Do I have, um, the right house?"

"Steve is watching A Very Wipe Out Christmas with the family, but I'll pass on the message. 'Stop looking in the window while I'm showering, you perv', right? Oh, and I'll need your last name, cause I, ha ha, I can just about guarantee there's more than one Becky."

"No, uh, it's not that." Becky blushed. "Steve was on a cruise with me a while ago and I ... I kinda like him, you know? So I thought I'd look him up. I hope that's not too weird."

"Right. You like Steve." Roger laughed. "So is this a cruel prank, or are you just really, really drunk? 'Cause I want to know which of you I'm gonna be laughing at tomorrow."

"Look, Biff -- can I just see him?"

"Be my guest." Roger flung open the door. "You two kids get acquainted while I go make the popcorn. Hey, Steve!"

The Smith family turned their heads to see Becky in the doorway. For a moment they looked confused. Then Stan shouted. Francine shrieked. Hayley and Steve turned pale. And all four of them ran screaming out of the room.

"Look!" Klaus said. "Look, I'm on the far side of mein bowl, all the way ova heah! I am part of the family too! Why ah we running?"

"Becky blew her chance," Roger corrected. "What you need is a persona. You know, remake yourself into the girl of his dreams!"

"What's the girl of his dreams like?"

"Aaaaaaa!" Steve shrieked.

Becky practically jumped out of her skin. She lost her grip on one of the bags, and suddenly jellybeans and chocoballs from the candy store were rolling all over the floor. "Oh no, oh no, oh dammit, dammit..." she muttered to herself, trying to gather up the bags and leave.

"It's you again!" Steve said, approaching her. "You're ... you're haunting me, aren't you! Your spirit is trying to take vengeance on me! Oh, god!"

"No, no, it's not like that at all, Steve, I'm just--" Becky stammered. Everyone was staring at them -- except for the people who were slipping on chocoballs. As far as not making a scene went, she was failing pretty hard.

"You're angry with me because of your untimely death -- and you're jealous! That's why you've cursed me to strike out with girls!"

"Uh, what?"

"I mean, what, like I just happened to stumble across the eight girls in this mall who hate Klingon pick-up lines? I thought it was pretty fishy. It's so obvious now!"

"Steve, calm down! I'm alive, see?" She grabbed his hand and put it to her chest -- probably not such a good idea. He was stricken with the overwhelming power of Touching a Boob, and fainted. Becky picked up all her bags and tried to make her escape, mortified; everything was going wrong! But before she could --

"Becky?" Steve was picking himself up and looking around. The floor was still covered with people lying down and moaning, victims of the little round candies. "Becky, all these people... hey, what do you have there? All that junk food... wait, that's it! Your spirit can't rest because you were eaten, so now it wanders the earth, a hungry ghost!"

Becky sighed. "Fine, you win. I'm a ghost. And I am pretty hungry."

Steve ripped open one of her candy bars. "Well, maybe that's how we calm your vengeful heart. Eat this!"

She bit into the thick, sweet lump of chocolate and nuts. He was just such a kid -- but he was pretty cute. And hey, at least here was a way she could spend time with him.

"Well, do you feel less vengeful?"

"Yeah, a lot less vengeful. Feed me another one."

They went through four candy bars, two bags of chips, a whole carton of ice cream, and an entire bag of rapidly congealing grease-covered food from the food court before Becky was too stuffed to continue.

"Well?" Steve asked.

"Mmm. Well what?".

"Huh. You're not floating into Heaven."

Becky groaned. "I'm not floating anywhere anytime soon." She felt like she'd eaten a couch. If they hadn't been in public, she would have unzipped her jeans.

"Maybe we're not doing it right. Maybe I need to take you out to a fancy restaurant or something?"

Becky's heart leapt. He'd just asked her out!... sort of! If only she wasn't so full... but if she waited, who knew what could happen?

What you're about to read is an interactive writing thingy on the internet about the women in MY television show gaining weight for your reading pleasure." Stan freshens his tobacco pipe, "Now before you go running off and adding your own stories, the creator of this interactive has a few rules."

Stan spins his recliner to a presentation board.

"Number one! Chapters must be of good size and contain more than 2 paragraphs. If that is too much work for you then maybe you shouldn't be writing."

Stan clears his throat.

"Number 2. No male weight gain of any kind. There is another 'American Dad' interactive that allows you to do that."

"3. No females under the age of 18 allowed. Hayley is 18, but anything younger than her will be deleted. So sorry if you somehow have any attraction towards Debbie."

"Número 4. Only light sex such as kissing and groping is allowed to stay. You can hunt further action, but not in detail."

"And last, but not least 5. This show is pretty unrealistic. There are CIA experiments, my son was pregnant for an episode, and so on. Weight gain can be caused for any reason, but it's up to you whether it's more realistic or unrealistic. Although, the creator would prefer unrealistic, quick weight gain."

"Welp, that is all. I hope you enjoy! And be sure to tune into to Animation Domination on Sundays!"
